title.narrative: PH 2020 GAA: Private Sector Engagement to Address GBV, Economic Exclusion Among Vulnerable Groups in Metro Cebu

description.narrative: The objective of the 2020 GAA project is to focus activities more on building men’s capacity to become advocates in upholding the rights of women and girls in target communities. The work on private sector will also be strengthened to orient companies on compliance with laws and policies i.e. Magna Carta of Women, Child Protection Laws including Child Labor Law as well as the Labor Code of the Philippines. The project also aims to document stories of success in the work/partnership with the private sector.

title.narrative: Number of community members (incl. community, religious and traditional leaders) participating in awareness raising sessions

title.narrative: Number of community members participating in awareness raising sessions

description.narrative: Number of community members participating in awareness raising sessions

comment.narrative: A total of 217 community members (106 males, 111 females) attended the awareness raising session.;

The Drama sa Trumpa reached 10,000 community members. A certificate from the barangay is secured by the project as MOV. Out of the 10,000 community members, 265 (60 males, 205 females) participated in the question and answer portion.;
The project already achieved the target in the last reporting period.;

title.narrative: Number of dialogues with private sector representatives

description.narrative: Number of dialogues with private sector representatives

title.narrative: Number of dialogues with private sector representatives

description.narrative: Number of dialogues with private sector representatives

comment.narrative: The project was able to train 51 private sectors and out of the 51, only 36 companies responded to the monitoring of their plans and compliance because of their difficulties in coping with their losses during the lockdown up until now.;
The project were able to conduct dialogues to 3 new partner companies namely, JoDin, IT Companies, and Cebu Technological Sciences.;
Two partner companies were monitored last March 2020.;

comment.narrative: The Compilation of Stories of Triumph on its lay-outing stage.;
The Stories of triumph is now in its lay-outing and will be published/reproduced in October 2020.;

title.narrative: Number of trainings on GBV and decent work attended by private sector representatives

description.narrative: Number of trainings on GBV and decent work attended by private sector representatives

comment.narrative: The project conducted 1 training on GBV and Magna Carta of Women participated in by 22 companies with 26 individuals.;

Though the project does not have a target training for the 4th quarter, we opted to conduct the last Training-Orientation on GBV, Magna Carta of Women, and SOGIE because there were still variances in the number of companies that should be trained on the mentioned topics.;
